intro: Crepis sartoriana, commonly known as the field mouse-ear. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its small, hairy leaves and yellow flowers. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, it often grows in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. It is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and adaptability.
